title: 2012 election : support for Romney and Obama , by ethnic group
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 4 different Races for 2 groups Obama, and Romney that are presented on the X-axis.
Race Black had the maximum Share of respondents among all 2 groups, and it was for Obama. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Race Black for Romney.
In Race White (non-Hispanic), Romney had the highest Share of respondents among all 4 Races and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Race Black.
The maximum Share of respondents for Romney that was found in Race White (non-Hispanic) was 11.8 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Race Black.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 4 different Races on X-axis for 2 groups Obama, and Romney. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Out of all 2 groups, Obama had the highest Share of respondents in Race Black and Romney had the lowest Share of respondents in Race Black.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 4 different Races for 2 groups Obama, and Romney that are presented on the X-axis.
Race Black had the maximum Share of respondents among all 2 groups, and it was for Obama. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Race Black for Romney.
In Race White (non-Hispanic), Romney had the highest Share of respondents among all 4 Races and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Race Black.
The maximum Share of respondents for Romney that was found in Race White (non-Hispanic) was 11.8 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Race Black.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 4 different Races on X-axis for 2 groups Obama, and Romney. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Race Black had the maximum Share of respondents among all 2 groups, and it was for Obama. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Race Black for Romney.
In Race White (non-Hispanic), Romney had the highest Share of respondents among all 4 Races and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Race Black.
The maximum Share of respondents for Romney that was found in Race White (non-Hispanic) was 11.8 times larger than the minimum Share of respondents observed in Race Black.
Out of all 2 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents was found in case of Obama.
On average, the Race White (non-Hispanic) had the highest Share of respondents for all 2 groups Obama, and Romney. Whereas Nonwhite had the lowest average Share of respondents.
